Well I was planning my first mission to eve today and when my transfer window came close, I placed my maneuver node as usual.

However, the game doesn't show me the important closest approach tags! I can't continue my mission without them ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Did anyone encounter this problem before? How to solve it? It works perfectly fine with the mun or minmus, but as soon as I try to plan an interplanetary flight, it won't display :/

![17262Mm.png](http://i.imgur.com/17262Mm.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-29T07:59:21Z" title="07/29/2015 07:59  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 29, 2015</time> by TrinityGER**

You don't have a maneuver node and are no where near your target's orbit..

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-29T07:41:48Z" title="07/29/2015 07:41  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 29, 2015</time> by Alshain**
Oh whoops I uploaded the wrong screenshot... Shame on me. I updated the post^^
Pull the maneuver node a little further in, it doesn't look like it is quite close enough.

I did of course. But nothing works. Even if I change my inclination.

After several restarts however, it finally works. Dunno what happened ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

IMHO the closest approach tags are pretty irksome. They only like to appear when you're relatively close to an encounter, even though they'd still be useful if they said your target is a full 90 degrees out of sync by the time you reach it's orbital altitude...

Would be really nice if they were *always* shown regardless of whether the game 'thinks' they're useful or not. I don't care if the closest approach is 10,000,000km, or right at the spot I'm sat at - more information makes for better course planning.

They always show if you're close enough to the orbital PLANE, but it really would be nice to see them even if you aren't ... it would let you do an initial burn without needing to plan the mid-course correction even before that burn.
